Adam Whitcroft

Designer and Iconographer

I’ve spent the past 6-and-a-bit years designing websites, icons and web apps. This year, however, I’d like to spend my downtime exploring new design disciplines like lettering and illustration. This is not to say I’ve lost interest in what I currently do — far from it — I’m just looking to grow as a designer.

You can follow me on Twitter, drop me an email or read about how I got into design in an interview I did with The Industry not too long ago.

Availability

I take on select freelance work — current availability of up to 10 hours a week — so if you want to work together let’s get talking!

Networks

Twitter, Dribbble, Instagram and most recently Behance.

Side Projects

Batch, Climacons, City Icons for Offscreen Magazine, Wirekit, Apaxy and Proto.

As much as I love product design I think it's important to actively explore different design disciplines, to learn something new and to put that to use. There is, of course, nothing wrong with specialising in a particular area of design, but not wanting to go out there and try everything just doesn't make sense to me. There is so much to explore in design, and I've only just touched the surface. I don't have a plan or a schedule, just a simple aim: to spend a little time whenever I can nurturing a new interest. I'll be sharing my progress on Dribbble, Behance or Instagram.

I'm generally not one for quotes, but I'll make an exception this once and end with: “Adventure is out there!”.
